body.p: Paragraph 11 of IAS 32 Financial Instruments: Presentation defines a financial asset to include ‘a contractual right to receive cash or another financial asset from another entity’. Paragraph 13 of that standard clarifies that ‘contractual’ refers to ‘an agreement between two or more parties that has clear economic consequences that the parties have little, if any, discretion to avoid, usually because the agreement is enforceable by law.’
